instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message:
this one works with charger. I don't get orange light on the charger only green. With BIL connected there is an X on battery, with BIL disconnected I get "Not Charging"
20 ohm at pin 17+18 and 27+28 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message: At least your BIL is bad. Are the battery parameters displayed correctly in OSX like cycle count, voltage, MAh?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message:
battery shows 0% but it is actually aroud 88%.
It shows only zeros in system report

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message: How do you know about the 80%? If it works in another laptop, it is either a dead ISL or SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message: yes, I took it from another laptop. i'll replace ISL and see

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message:
No luck with new ISL.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.29 with adapter. does that mean bad smc?

The computer looks and work great except for the battery... sad
